graph_title: Percentage of 4 to 5 year old children classified as underweight or overweight (including obese)
indicator_available: Prevalence of underweight or overweight (including obese) 4 to 5 year old children based on Body Mass Index (BMI) classifications
indicator_name: Prevalence of malnutrition (weight for height >+2 or <-2 standard deviation from the median of the WHO Child Growth Standards) among children under 5 years of age, by type (wasting and overweight)
SDG_GOAL__GLOBAL: Goal 2: End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture
SDG_TARGET__GLOBAL: Target 2.2: By 2030, end all forms of malnutrition, including achieving, by 2025, the internationally agreed targets on stunting and wasting in children under 5 years of age, and address the nutritional needs of adolescent girls, pregnant and lactating women and older persons
SDG_INDICATOR__GLOBAL: Indicator 2.2.2: Prevalence of malnutrition (weight for height >+2 or <-2 standard deviation from the median of the WHO Child Growth Standards) among children under 5 years of age, by type (wasting and overweight)
CONTACT_ORGANISATION__GLOBAL: United Nations Children’s Fund (UNICEF), World Health Organisation (WHO), World Bank (WB)
SDG_GOAL: Goal 2: End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture
SDG_TARGET: Target 2.2: By 2030, end all forms of malnutrition, including achieving, by 2025, the internationally agreed targets on stunting and wasting in children under 5 years of age, and address the nutritional needs of adolescent girls, pregnant and lactating women and older persons
SDG_INDICATOR: Indicator 2.2.2: Prevalence of malnutrition (weight for height >+2 or <-2 standard deviation from the median of the WHO Child Growth Standards) among children under 5 years of age, by type (wasting and overweight)
STAT_CONC_DEF: Children with low weight for age are known as underweight. Overweight and obesity is when a person is too heavy for his or her height. Body mass index (BMI) is an index of weight-for-height. It is defined as a person’s weight in kilograms divided by the square of his/her height in meters (kg/m²). The BMI classification of each child is derived by calculating the child’s BMI centile. This calculation uses age and sex as well as height and weight to take into account different growth patterns in children at different ages.
